page.title: 01MERTON AREA - AN OVERVIEW
page.content: The area of countryside centreing upon the village of Merton,Oxfordshire is typical of much of the agricultural land to be found in the north of the County.It is a relatively flat area of land which supports a mixed agricultural economy.Beef and dairy cattle are kept as are sheep.Farms are relatively large,most people tending to live in the villages rather than in the open countryside.Arable crops such as wheat and barley are grown.Local employment is scarce,most of the villagers commute to the local towns or to the Government Ordinance Depot to work.Of particular interest are a few fields in the block which have been farmed traditionally without the use of modern chemicals or sprays.These support many interesting forms of plantlife fast disappearing from the modern countryside.
